alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 6:55PM PST until January 11 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...WHAT...Snow above 2500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...The foothills of the Cascades, Siskiyou, and the high terrain of the Kalmiopsis wilderness mountains in Douglas, Jackson, and eastern Curry counties, including the Tiller-Trail highway and portions of Interstate 5 and highways 62 and 140 above 2500 feet. This includes Ashland, Prospect, and Union Creek. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
